actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Executive Comment Requested from Justice, GAO.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations

official_title: A bill to amend title 31 of the United States Code to provide that interest on a money judgment in a civil action against the United States shall run from the date of the commencement of such action instead of the date the judgment becomes final.

summary.text: Amends Federal law regarding interest on money judgments to provide that interest is payable on a district court judgment only from the date the civil action was filed (currently, from the date the judgment becomes final).

titles.title: A bill to amend title 31 of the United States Code to provide that interest on a money judgment in a civil action against the United States shall run from the date of the commencement of such action instead of the date the judgment becomes final.
